questions.question: Look! We ...................... to crash.
questions.description: We use the present continuous to talk about actions and situations that are going on at the moment of speaking.

questions.question: I wish I .................... a better memory.
questions.description: After I wish, we use past verbs with a present or future meaning.

questions.question: After he ......................... his homework, he went out to play.
questions.description: We can use time conjunctions to talk about two actions or events that happen one after the other.

questions.question: I .............................. him for very long when we got married.
questions.description: We use continuous forms to emphasize the continuation of an action. However, the verb know is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: I .......................... a lot of movies recently.
questions.description: We use the present perfect continuous to talk about repeated actions and events.

questions.question: I .............................. her for two weeks.
questions.description: The verb know is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: When I woke up, Mummy .............................. breakfast.
questions.description: We use the past perfect to suggest that an action had finished before another action commenced.

questions.question: I ............................. in the same job for ten years.
questions.description: The present perfect and the present perfect continuous tenses are both possible with similar meanings.

questions.question: I told him that I .........................
questions.description: The past perfect is common after past verbs of saying and thinking.

questions.question: I thought I ........................ the money a week before.
questions.description: The past perfect is common after past verbs of saying and thinking.

questions.question: I was tired because I ............................... for a long time.
questions.description: With the time expressions for and since, we use the perfect and perfect continuous tenses.
